alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Denton; Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 11 at 1:12PM CDT until August 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT SATURDAY FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ALONG AND WEST OF I-35 CORRIDOR... The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Red Flag Warning in effect through 10 pm Saturday for critical to extreme fire weather conditions along and west of the I-35 corridor. * AFFECTED AREA...Along and west of the I-35 corridor. * TIMING...Now through Saturday evening. * WINDS...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts between 20 and 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...From 105 to 111 degrees. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition and spread of wildfires is possible due to persistent hot and dry conditions. Lightning strikes from isolated thunderstorm activity could also spark new wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
